reference.shortdesc: Use the verb for operations that take place at the Key Receiving Device (KRD) during TR-34-prrotocol key-transport-related operations, as specified in X9 TR34-2012.

section.p: The TR-34 Protocol describes the data objects and cryptograms needed for securely provisioning a symmetric key from a Key Distribution Host (KDH) to a Key Receiving Device (KRD). Although designed for 1-way key distribution, such as between a host computer (KDH) and an ATM (KRD), the protocol can be used for peer-to-peer key distribution as well. The main requirement for either use of the protocol is a Certificate Authority (CA) trusted by both the KDH and the KRD.
This service is used to perform these operations:

ul.li:
2PASSRCV: The TR34 Key Transport (2-pass) token (KT-KDH) RECEIVE service.
KT-KDH: (INPUT, input_token). Key transport (2-pass) token received from KDH.
CredKDH: (INPUT, cred_kdh). KDH credential (X.509 certificate) with ID and public key.
RT-KRD: (INPUT, input_freshness_indicator).Token originally sent by the KRD to the KDH and now used for validation.
D-krd: (INPUT, private_key_identifier). The private key matching the public key in CredKRD.
Kn-T: (OUTPUT, output_key_identifier). key token containing the transported TMK/KBPK.

1PASSRCV: The TR34 Key Transport (1-pass) token (KT-KDH) RECEIVE service.
KT-KDH: (INPUT, input_token). Key transport (1-pass) token received from KDH.
CredKDH: (INPUT, cred_kdh). KDH credential (X.509 certificate) with ID and public key.
Timestamp-min: (INPUT, input_freshness_indicator). Minimum timestamp value allowed, could be the last timestamp received or a bootstrap value.
D-krd: (INPUT, private_key_identifier). The private key matching the public key in CredKRD.
Kn-T: (OUTPUT, output_key_identifier). CCA key token containing the transported TMK/KBPK.
Timestamp-rcv: (OUTPUT, output_freshness_indicator). The timestamp value received in the KT-KDH.

section.p: This verb can create either the ITU T-REC-X.690-201508 or the ASC X9 TR-34-2012 variant of the SignedAttributes section in the SignerInfo of the token created, for 2-pass or 1-pass services. CSNDT34R has been updated to accept either format of the SignedAttributes token.

ol.li: This verb supports compliant-tagged key tokens.
Compliant-tagged AES and DES tokens are exportable using this service. A compliant-tagged RSA private key is required.
The RT-KRD token can be created with correct formatting using the RT-KRD processing of the CSNBRNGL service. See for more details.

RSA 2048 bit and 3072 bit keys are supported by . This allows strength equivalent to an AES 128-bit key. TR-34 explicitly supports only RSA 2048-bit keys so some vendors will only support that key size.
